Hello.

On 5/11/05, taraonholiday <taraonholiday@...> wrote:
> I'm=
 a tester, and am trying to organise the set up of JUnit to test
> somethin=
g for me...

Ok.

> I want to use JUnitPerf to call a JUnit that will test =
a service
> calling a third party provider.

Ok.

> The service will sit on=
 a unix server, but where do I run the JUnit
> from?

When I was running a =
similar setup, I ran from my development machine.
Optimally, you'd run from=
 a bank of "n" QA machines, where n>1.

> Does JUnit have to be on the unix=
 server, or can it be run from a
> development machine?

JUnit would be on =
the machine that the test was run from.

> Also, Are there any issues that =
I should consider if the service
> communicates via https down an encrypted=
 line?

Shouldn't be. If the code your testing can generate an https
connec=
tion, then your fine.

> Thanks for any clarifiations anyone can provide

J=
ust a couple of thoughts to get you started.

Simon
